item.title: Tokenization Grand Prix Application - Cogito Finance TFUND
item.dc:creator: Kenneth246
item.description:
I. Product Summary

Project name : Cogito Finance

Product name : TFUND

Product type / underlying asset : Product Type : Tokenized Fund, Underlying Asset : Blackrock iShares 0-3 Month Treasury Bond ETF (SGOV)

Issuer jurisdiction : Cayman Islands

Product website - www.cogito.finance

Primary contact name, title, and method of contact

  • Primary Contact Name : Cloris Chen
  • Title : CEO
  • Method of Contact : cloris@cogito.finance(Email), @clorisxchen (Telegram)

II. Company Details

Company description

Cogito Finance provides institutional-grade investment products by bringing fixed-income assets and equities onchain. Through tokenization, Cogito addresses challenges in DeFi, such as unsustainable yield farming, credit risk, and regulatory uncertainty. As a SingularityNET ecosystem partner, Cogito leverages Ben Goertzel’s expertise to implement Artificial Intelligence in its processes, including portfolio management.

Key personnel biographies

Cloris Chen - CEO

Cloris combines a banking background with hands-on DeFi experience. She spent 6 years at HSBC and served as treasury director for a unicorn startup. She holds a Master’s in CS from UPenn and a Master’s in Economics from HKUST.

Norton Wang - CTO

Norton has over 10 years of blockchain engineering experience at startups like TradeBlock, Axoni, and DFINITY. He has worked on everything from Bitcoin script to enterprise blockchains to market making bots. He holds a CS degree from Cornell University

Nejc Znidar - Co-Founder & Chief Quant

Nejc has extensive experience as a financial modeler and analyst and has contributed to various research areas at SingularityNET in the last 7 years. He worked as a data scientist in Zalando, biggest German online fashion retailer before that… He holds a Master’s in Quantitative Science from Tilburg University.

Kenneth Ng - Head of BD

Kenneth is a seasoned sales professional with a background in reputable companies such as crypto.com and the TON Foundation. He holds a BBA in Finance and Information Systems from HKUST.

Sandra Grabowiec - Communications & Partnerships Lead

Sandra’s blockchain journey began in 2018 when she focused on smart contracts in her dissertation to later pursue a Master’s Degree in Blockchain and Digital Currency from UNIC. Her hands-on experience in DeFi, business consultancy, and education reflects her passion for the blockchain and fintech landscape.

LC Stroud - Content Strategist

LC is an experienced marketing strategist with a vast portfolio of clients across both Web2 and Web3, namely Longines and Ajax FC. Throughout her years in the field, she’s delved into various blockchain topics, including DeFi protocols, decentralization, and regulatory aspects. She studied at University of Nicosia under Andreas Antonopoulos and holds certificates in ‘Introduction to Decentralized Finance (DeFi)’ and ‘Blockchain Technology and Digital Currency’.

Team size

8 members

Years in operation

2 years

III. Product Information

Describe the product

TFUND, is a fund product offered by Cogito that invests in short-term U.S. treasury bills. The fund is issued under a CIMA licensed SPC registered in the Cayman Islands.

Our operational setup enables us to facilitate 24/7 subscriptions and redemptions in FIAT our stablecoin with a maximum lead time of two business days.

Upon KYC completion, investors are provided with access to Cogito’s investment dashboard where they could easily subscribe and redeem TFUND. The dashboard also provides the investor with various account management tools to view their balance, managing personal information and wallet addresses.

Please see below for a screenshot of the investor dashboard.

Describe the underlying asset

TFUND primarily invests in Blackrock iShares 0-3 Month Treasury Bond ETF (Ticker : SGOV). The fund may hold some assets in stablecoins to facilitate quick redemptions for operational efficiency

  • SGOV Fact Sheet
  • SGOV Prospectus

The investment objective of the Fund is to achieve returns and capital appreciation. Hence, the fund also has the flexibility to hold stablecoins, cash or cash equivalents for various purposes.

How is yield transferred to the tokenholder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

The yield is transferred to the tokenholder through price accrual. The price of TFUND is updated whenever there is a change in the funds NAV (Net Asset Value). It is also important to note that investors would be able to easily view these changes through the Cogito’s dashboard alongside NAV reports specially circulated for the investor.

What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?

Issuer : Ergo Sum SPC, a company incorporated with limited liability and registered as a segregated portfolio company under the laws of the Cayman Islands, registered with CIMA under registration no. 403321

Investment Manager: Ergo Sum Management Ltd, registered with the BVI Financial Services Commission as an Approved Manager pursuant to the BVI Investment Business (Approved Managers) Regulations, 2012

What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents?

The primary underlying asset for TFUND is Blackrock iShares 0-3 Month Treasury Bond ETF (SGOV).

Cogito may also choose to invest into other relevant assets for TFUND (i.e directly in TBills, funds or other ETFs) without any concentration limits in order to achieve the fund’s investment objective.

In order to facilitate this, Cogito has implemented a thorough due diligence process and will only invest with reputable companies, and counterparties.

Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio?

Not permitted

Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

Counterparty / Service Provider Scope of Service Website
Ogier Legal - Offshore Counsel https://www.ogier.com/
DavisPolk Legal - HK Counsel https://www.davispolk.com/
OC Advisory Legal - US Counsel https://www.ocstrategic.com/
Storm Legal - EU, Swiss & UK Counsel https://storm.partners/
Lead Bank FIAT & Banking https://www.lead.bank/
Circle FIAT & Banking https://www.circle.com/
Wintermute FIAT & Banking https://www.wintermute.com/
Soroban Fund Services Administrator https://sorobanfs.com/
Berkower Auditor https://berkower.io/
Doo Prime Broker & Custodian https://www.dooprime.com/
Sumsub KYC https://sumsub.com/
SingularityNET Artificial Intelligence https://singularitynet.io/
Ergo Sum Management Ltd Investment Manager
(BVI FSC Registered) Not Applicable

What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain

$500K USD equivalent in TFUND on Ethereum (as of August, 2024)

What are the standard fees (i.e., subscription, redemption, management, etc.)?

Our standard fees are as follows :

  • Subscription Fee : Waived
  • Redemption Fee: 0.1% on the redemption proceeds
  • Management Fee: 0.3% per annum of the Net Asset Value

As part of this strategic partnership, Cogito proposes to offer a 100% fee rebate incurred exclusively to MakerDAO and a 50% rebate for all of MakerDAO’s affiliates. This offer is a testament of recognizing MakerDAO as a leader within the web3.0 space, and ties in well with our objective to scale our business globally.

The rebate currently shall be in the form of $CGV tokens, mechanism and frequency can be done on a quarterly basis upon mutual agreement of all counter-parties involved.

Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets?

Additional expenses are incurred by the collective fund, i.e. audit, fund administration, trading and custodian fees.

How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users)

All clients (retail & corporate) are required to complete KYC through Cogito’s platform prior to subscribing to TFUND; encompassing “primary users”. There are no secondary users of TFUND.

On the technical front, TFUND is issued on Ethereum with transfer restrictions a- which makes it non-transferable by default unless certain parameters are met (i.e. Both the sender and recipient have completed KYC and whitelisted wallet addresses on Cogito)

What is the monthly transaction volume for the product?

Cogito has issued $500K USD equivalent in TFUND since the launch of its product in Q2 this year. Considering the growth & demand in on-chain treasury products alongside our strategic direction, we estimate to 20-50x our $AUM in the next 12 months.

What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions?

Investors can subscribe to the TFUND token on each New York business day and need to complete all subscription documents at 24:00 (UTC) two business days in advance. Subscriptions may be received in Fiat currency or stablecoins.

Similarly, Investors can redeem TFUND tokens on each New York business day and need to complete all redemption documents at 24:00 (UTC) two business days in advance. Redemption proceeds may be received in Fiat currency or stablecoins.

There are no interruptions in our subscription & redemption operations thus far.

Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved.

Subscription Flow

  • SparkDAO completes the KYC process and whitelists wallet addresses in Cogito
  • SparkDAO initiates a subscription order for TFUND through Cogito’s online dashboard, the cryptocurrency is deposited to Cogito’s Fund Vault address in the backend.
  • Cogito issues TFUND tokens to SparkDAO’s whitelisted wallet.
  • Cogito sends the cryptocurrency to Doo Prime, where necessary conversions to fiat in order to purchase the underlying assets are also manage
  • Ergo Sum Management Ltd (Investment manager) acts as an investment manager of the fund.
  • Cogito’s licensed fund administrator provides price updates to both Cogito and SparkDAO in relation to the performance of the fund, SparkDAO will also receive regular NAV reports on a mutually agreed cadence.

Subscription - User Experience

On an operational perspective, SparkDAO can simply subscribe to TFUND through the Cogito dashboard online by selecting the “Buy TFUND” function and indicating the equivalent amount in cryptocurrency. The screenshot below displays a sample subscription using USDC.

Once the subscription request is submitted, the investor will be issued TFUND tokens to SparkDAOs whitelisted wallet address.

Redemption Flow

  • SparkDAO initiates a redemption request for TFUND through Cogito’s online dashboard, the TFUND tokens are sent back to Cogito’s Fund Vault address in the backend.
  • Ergo Sum Management Ltd (Investment Manager) obtains instant notification of the request and initiates a liquidation order to Doo Prime, selling & performing the necessary conversions back to the investor’s chosen cryptocurrency.
  • Upon completion of the liquidation, the cryptocurrency is sent to Cogito’s Fund Vaults and then back SparkDAO’s whitelisted wallet.

Redemption - User Experience

Similarly, Investors can redeem TFUND through the Cogito dashboard online by selecting the “Sell TFUND” function and indicating the equivalent amount of TFUND tokens to sell back into the cryptocurrency of choice. The screenshot below displays a redemption request to USDC.

Once the redemption request is submitted, the investor’s TFUND tokens will be sent back to Cogito’s TFUND Vault. The underlying assets (i.e. Blackrock iShares ETF) held in Doo Prime will be sold back by our Investment Manager to cryptocurrency and deposited to SparkDAO’s whitelisted wallet.

Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work.

In addition to our partnership with leading brokerage platforms such as Doo Prime, Cogito keeps a portion of its reserve in stablecoin to enhance operational efficiency of its clients should expedited subscription or redemption requests are made by key investors, such as MakerDAO.

As an example, this can be facilitated through Cogito lending stablecoins to the fund which will be used to facilitate the redemption. The fund would repay Cogito once the liquidation of the underlying asset has taken place.

With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.)

Subscriptions : USDC (Ethereum) and USDT (Ethereum)

Redemptions : USDC (Ethereum) and USDT (Ethereum)

Upon the request of the investor, Cogito has the capability to make conversions to other cryptocurrencies - enabled through our partnership with Wintermute.

What are your future development plans for the product?

Our focus in the immediate term is executing on our Go-to-market strategy, having TFUND successfully integrated within the treasury strategy of the global web3.0 ecosystem starting with Ethereum.

As a next step, Cogito is also looking into deploying the product on other reputable blockchain networks in order to expand the accessibility, its priority will be driven by project demand and strategic partnerships on the chain level.

On the utility side, we’re also keen in exploring the integration of TFUND with DeFi applications for composability. A use-case that is of particular interest is having TFUND tokens accepted as collateral on lending/borrowing platforms.

Our commitment in delivering an institutional-grade product will shape our future development plans for TFUND. These development plans will also be in-line with feedback from investors as Cogito continues to scale.

IV. Legal Structure

Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates

TFUND is issued through a bankruptcy-remote collective investment vehicle, Ergo Sum SPC.

Ergo Sum SPC is a regulated mutual fund under the laws of the Cayman Islands with registration 403321. The Company is registered with CIMA pursuant to section 4(3) of the Mutual Funds Act.

The SPC is a separate legal entity and fully bankruptcy-remote from the remaining Cogito legal structure.

Per Cayman regulations, please also note that TFUND is not available to investors from the following jurisdictions.

  • OFAC Sanctions List
  • United States
  • The People’s Republic of China

What regulatory bodies oversee the product?

The regulatory body that oversees TFUND is the Cayman Islands Monetary Authority (CIMA)

What licenses, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, exemptions does your product or company hold?

Cogito holds a mutual fund license from CIMA and is not required to have a VASP license.

  • Announcement
  • Cointelegraph

How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness

TFUND is issued under a Cayman Segregated Portfolio Company (Ergo Sum SPC), regulated by CIMA. A Segregated Portfolio company can create several segregated portfolios which legally separate the assets and liabilities from each other, therefore protecting assets from liabilities of other portfolios.

At this stage, Ergo Sum SPC only manages one segregated portfolio, TFUND (Treasury SP). Any new products launched by Cogito would be offered through a separate segregated portfolio.

Ergo Sum SPC is a standalone legal entity which is separate from Cogito’s legal structure and therefore, bankruptcy remote.

What rights do tokenholders have?

As a licensed product under CIMA, TFUND tokenholders have voluntary redemption and repurchase rights. TFUND tokens can be redeemed for USDC, or USDT through the Cogito platform.

Investors are required to sign a subscription agreement prior to their purchase of TFUND. This document is accessible through Cogito’s onboarding process and contractual rights outlined in the agreement are applicable to all parties.

Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers?

None

Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO

None

Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product

There is no tax imposed on returns of the TFUND as it is registered in the Cayman Islands. However, Investors should consult with their legal, tax and tax advisors in relation to:

(i) The legal and regulatory requirements within their countries for the purchase, holding, redeeming or disposing of the Tokens;

(ii) Any foreign exchange restrictions to which they are subject in their own countries in relation to the purchase, holding, redeeming or disposing of the Tokens

(iii) The legal, tax, financial or other consequences of subscribing for, purchasing, holding, redeeming or disposing of the Tokens.

V. Performance, Reporting, and Technical

Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark

Blacrock iShares 0-3 Month Treasury Bond ETF (SGOV) is the primary underlying asset of TFUND.

The table below showcases the average annual returns of the ETF as reported by Blackrock.

Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these?

Investors can choose to obtain NAV reports in relation to their TFUND portfolio on a regular basis (Daily, Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly). These reports are prepared by our licensed fund administrator and circulated directly to the investor.

Key information included in the NAV report are as follows:

  • Number of TFUND Tokens
  • Market Value of TFUND Tokens (USD)
  • NAV per TFUND Token (During the Period)

Based on the above information, the report will also display the following summary for the investors convenience

  • Beginning Net Asset Value (NAV) - in USD
  • Net Profit / Less - in USD
  • Ending Net Asset Value - in USD
  • Net Returns - in %

Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product

Cogito has appointed TFUND’s fund administrator, Soroban Fund Services to perform the accounting and NAV calculation for TFUND. Soroban Fund Services (Hong Kong) Limited holds a Trust or Company Service Provider License in Hong Kong (License No. TC008968) and is subject to regulation under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615 of the Laws of Hong Kong).

The annual financial audit is also performed by Citylinkers Group and signed off by Berkower.

CityLinkers and Berkower LLC both offer comprehensive corporate services, including finance, auditing, tax planning, and compliance, with a strong emphasis on personalized service and professional standards. Their global reach and expertise are highlighted by CityLinkers’ bespoke solutions in Hong Kong and China, and Berkower’s IAPA membership and ranking as a top hedge fund auditor.

Describe the technical implementation of your product

The Cogito TFUND vault is an ERC-20 token with transfer restrictions that follow the ERC-1404 standard. Whitelisted addresses are stored onchain in a separate smart contract that can be updated independently of the fund contract. Token transfers may only occur to and from whitelisted addresses.

Subscription and redemption requests are made to the vault contract. Once the investor completes the offchain processes, the Cogito team will approve the investor’s subscription or redemption transaction and transfer stablecoins to or from the vault contract. For compliance purposes, the Cogito team is able to mint, burn, and transfer investor tokens according to the terms of the PPM.

Token holders earn a return by holding TFUND, where the token price is expected to increase in value over time. That change in token price directly reflects the returns generated by the underlying portfolio held by the Fund.

The TFUND token price is calculated as the Net Asset Value (“NAV”) per token. The token price can be derived by dividing the NAV of the Fund by the total outstanding supply of TFUND. The TFUND token price was launched with a default value of 1.00.

The TFUND Vault will use multisig and require multiple private keys, including the Fund’s independent third-party fund manager to authorize and sign off on transactions involving onchain assets. The use of on-ramp and off-ramp services will also be limited to authorized representatives from the Cogito team via multisig operations. Off-chain assets, meanwhile, are held on the Fund’s regulated custodians’ platforms, and all actions initiated by any one core team member will require checking and confirmation by another core team member to be authorized. In addition, the Fund’s independent fund manager will have oversight and governance control over all fund movements involving on-chain and off-chain assets held by the Fund. Even in the event of a smart contract breach or a hack, almost all of the TFUND Vault assets are held with regulated custodians at any given time

What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?

Cogito has successfully undergone a code security assessment for TFUND by Salus Security on August, 2024

Salus is a research-oriented security and zk firm, partners of the Binance ecosystem and has a track record of securing over 200 projects with zero exploits. We would be more than happy to provide the audit report on a separate email.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs

Cogito does not have any previous working relationship with MakerDAO.

Cogito’s institutional-grade investment products are designed for the global web3.0 ecosystem, with DAOs as a segment of interest due to its value proposition.

One of Cogito’s strategic partners is SingularityDAO, a decentralized Portfolio Management Protocol designed to enable anybody to safely and easily manage crypto assets.

Cogito’s collaboration with SingularityDAO is multifaceted, and includes areas such as AI-research, marketing and community management. SingularityDAO also utilizes Cogito’s TFUND as part of its crypto treasury management strategy.

Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem?

We would like to build additional rails to enhance accessibility for users to own DAI. One of the ways we envision this is to add TFUND as a collateral token to borrow DAI directly from Maker.

Composability is one of the core benefits DeFi and, we would like to extend it for RWA tokens such as TFUND

Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

Cogito’s TFUND has been integrated with Polytrade, a leading RWA marketplace platform (Announcement Link)

This integration enhances TFUND’s accessibility and discoverability for investors looking to diversify into the US T-Bill market.

Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?

Yes, the launch of TFUND marks a beginning for Cogito’s suite of institutional-grade investment products.

Under the guidance and support of Dr Ben Goertzel (CEO of SingularityNET), we’re currently building XFUND, an advanced AI-Powered Tokenized Equity Portfolio that employs Natural Language Processing (NLP) and machine learning techniques for its operations.

With our team’s strong track-record in traditional finance & banking, XFUND is strategically positioned to capitalize the best of both TradFi & AI, and presents as a great alternative for the treasury management of Spark and other SubDAOs as it caters.

VII. Supplementary Documents

  • Private Placement Memorandum (Ergo Sum SPC - PPM)
  • Private Placement Memorandum (Treasury SP - PPM Supplement)
  • Subscription Agreement (Treasury SP - Subscription Agreement)
  • Redemption Agreement (Treasury SP - Redemption Request)
  • TFUND Code Security Assessment - Salus Security

The above documents will be provided as a supplement in a separate email.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: August 2024 Aligned Delegate Payment Requests
item.dc:creator: votewizard
item.description:
August 2024 Aligned Delegate Payment Requests

This forum post serves as the official record of Aligned Delegate payment requests for August 2024.

We didn’t include this compensation in the September 13th spell because it was focused on Phase 1B of the Endgame launch, which involved novel code and the activation of the new tokens. We didn’t want to overload it.

For this reason, we plan to include these payments in the spell scheduled for September 26th.

Since the compensation calculation system in place for most of August was the same one we used in the previous month, we’ll stick with that system. Starting next month, we’ll switch to the new system that was approved at the end of August. This is consistent with how we’ve handled the changes in AD compensations in the past.

We need the ADs to submit their payment requests before September 19th, EOD. Payment requests submitted after this deadline will not be considered for the current month and will have to wait for the next one.

Each payment request should include the following information:

  • The Ethereum addresses to which the payments should be sent.
  • The specific amounts of MKR and DAI to be distributed to the address.
  • A description, clarifying the purpose of the payment.
  • Cryptographic signatures from their EA addresses for any new addresses to authorize them to receive future payments, including the text “Authorize [address] to receive payments” and a timestamp (this only needs to be done the first time an address is used).

The cryptographic signature is not needed if the address is the EA address of the AD.

You can refer to the Max Payment Limit column to determine the maximum amount that can be requested for a payment.

MKR Buffer

Calculations can be found here - NEW MakerDAO Aligned Delegates Tracker - Google Sheets

You can also use this Dune dashboard to track the changes in the amount of MKR delegated to each AD during the month:
https://dune.com/queries/3926020/6600808/

If the total compensation requested surpasses the budget after accounting for the required buffer amount, we will contact the AD to review and possibly revise their request. If adjustments are not made in a timely manner, we won’t include them in the spell.

A quick note about @byteron AD: they served as a reserve delegate for two days in August. However, under the previous compensation system, the following rule applied:

2.6.3.4.1

An AD buffer stops accumulating when it contains 3 months of an AD’s budget. If an AD with 3 months of PD budget in their buffer moves from PD to RD, their buffer is not reduced but it does not continue to accumulate until it contains less than 3 months of RD budget.

As a result, their buffer won’t be reduced, but they won’t continue accumulating funds. We’ll also maintain the restriction limiting their buffer usage to that of a reserve delegate since they haven’t contributed to the Atlas work during August. Next month, everyone will be able to access their buffer contents because we will transition to the new compensation system.

Let me know if you have any questions or need further assistance!

@Aligned_Delegates

item.title: Sky Organizational Structure
item.dc:creator: Shiko
item.description:
Sky Organizational Structure


Illustration of the high-level roles in Sky

Notable context:

  • Anyone can submit a proposal. To pass, proposals need a minimum number of total votes (quorum) and majority agreement. For Weekly Cycle Proposals a Delegate must trigger the submission to make it proceed to a vote.
  • All Facilitators are assigned the Governance Scope and are the ones that enforces the governance rules.

SKY Holders [1 out of 3 governance bodies]

The SKY holders are the root of trust and authority in Sky. All authority and responsibility of other actors in Sky are delegated from SKY holders.

Purpose:

  • to combine economic incentives with governance power in a single token.

Activities:

  • Delegate their votes to a Delegate + AVC* or vote independently on proposals.

Delegates [1 out of 3 governance bodies]

Delegates represent SKY holders as administrative actors. They are intended to be non-political actors who help AVCs* draft proposals and help authors trigger Atlas Edit Weekly Cycle Proposals to make them proceed to a vote. In addition they are allowed to concurrently participate in workstreams related to Atlas Core Development.

Purpose:

  • to offload administrative work from SKY holders.

Activities:

  • Commit to an AVC* (delegates will lose their SKY delegations if they switch AVCs*).
  • Get SKY delegated to them and their chosen AVC*.
  • Draft proposals for their AVCs*.
  • Vote.
  • Review spells.
  • Do research, data collection, data processing, data review, drafting, peer review, etc. as part of their participation in workstreams related to the Atlas Core Development.
  • Sign off on proposals, according to AVC* instructions.
  • Uphold the Spirit of the Atlas and maintain Universal Alignment of the Sky Ecosystem, including ensuring that the direction of the AVC* is not misaligned with the Atlas..
  • Trigger Atlas Edit Weekly Cycle Proposals to make them proceed to a vote.

Aligned Voter Committees (AVCs*) [1 out of 3 governance bodies]

AVCs* are groups of Sky governance participants with a common vision, who receive SKY delegations and use that representation to form opinions on existing proposals and to propose new ones.

Purpose:

  • to offload political work from SKY holders, by finding common political ground and translate it into practical proposals for protocol development, as well as managing protocol suppliers who turn the proposals into action.

Activities:

  • Issues proposals to be voted on (subject to the limitations described in Atlas).
  • Approve and offboard Ecosystem Actors and Stars, within the strict limitations provided by Atlas.
  • Instruct their Delegates on what to vote on proposals.

Stars [1 out of 2 implementers]

Stars do any work delegated by Sky Governance. As DAOs they have different organizational trade-offs than EAs and are able to give different guarantees for the work they perform.

As a blockchain native organization, Stars are well suited to handle critical mandates and privileges within very concrete limits. E.g. issuance of USDS loans.

Purpose:

  • does independent work for Sky under a DAO organizational structure.

Activities:

  • Do the work commissioned by Sky Governance.
  • Report on the progress of their work.

Ecosystem Actors (EA) [1 out of 2 implementers]

EAs do any work delegated by Sky Governance. As companies or persons, they have different organizational trade-offs than Stars and are able to give different guarantees for the work they perform.

As legal entities, EAs are well suited to do scope limited work. E.g. building software, provide consuntancy services and hosting websites.

Purpose:

  • does independent work for Sky under a company or person organizational structure.

Activities:

  • Do the work commissioned by Sky Governance.
  • Report on the progress of their work.

Red flags and feedback

During the course of our work, we noticed the following issues which in our view are counter productive.

  • Endgame documentation is very hard to read for newcomers to Sky - and probably also for the existing Sky community not involved in Endgame yet. Too much invention of new terms and no simple framework to attach them to.

    Suggestion: Consider writing introductory material focused on already established concepts like roles, responsibilities, and contracts/agreements.

  • Delegates seem like a weak role when they are only allowed to vote according to their AVCs* opinion. If only a few AVCs* exist, how do SKY holders adequately express their preferences?
    This imbalance also risks making the decision making process non-transparent, when Delegates can’t vote against its AVCs’* recommendation and therefore don’t have to convince the Delegates of the proposal in public discussions.
    Even though the intention is that Delegates should not be political, the fact that they need SKY votes to keep their position, forces them to be political actors to be successful.

    Suggestion: Do not force Delegates to vote according to AVCs* recommendation.

–

*’ Aligned Voter Committees (AVC) have been put on pause for a possible future removal and redelegation of their responsibilities.

** FacilitatorDAOs are not yet operational. For now, their duties are carried out by individual Facilitators.

4 posts - 3 participants

item.title: Analyzing the Effects of the 600 Million SKY Token Issuance
item.dc:creator: Jesus_Perez
item.description:
Let me share with you an analysis of the SKY issuance strategy. Given that interest rates can be modified, it clearly depends a lot on the strategy the project follows. Currently, if I’m not mistaken, the DSR yield is negative for the project, but it’s compensated because only a part of the DAIs are deposited. I believe it would be more profitable to incentivize the use of new USDs externally because it has more profitability for the protocol. Although, of course, delivering a yield is an important tool to be able to stabilize the price of the currency

mirror.xyz

Analyzing the Effects of the 600 Million SKY Token Issuance

We will attempt to conduct an initial analysis of the 600 million Token issuance that SKY has planned to carry out annually to remunerate USDS (DAI) depositors.

item.title: Tokenization Grand Prix Application - Hashnote $USYC
item.dc:creator: peterskalon
item.description:
I. Product Summary

1. Project name: US Yield Coin (USYC)

2. Product name: Hashnote International Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd. (iSDYF)

3. Product type / underlying asset: USYC is the on-chain representation of the regulated Hashnote International Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd. (“iSDYF”). The fund invests into reverse repo which is considered the safest way to keep cash in traditional finance, more safe than direct purchase of treasury bills. Net current yield is 4.737% and will float based on the secured overnight financing rate (SOFR).

4. Issuer jurisdiction: Cayman Islands

5. Product website: https://usyc.hashnote.com/

6. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact:

Name: Kat Daminova
Title: Director of Business Development
Email: kat@hashnote.com

II. Company Details

1. Company description: Hashnote is a regulated on-chain asset manager. We offer cash and treasury management, hedging and yield enhancement strategies and also long exposure to the crypto asset class.

We leverage most innovative technology and deep understanding of traditional finance to develop new products across our offerings: the US Yield Coin (USYC), a tokenized money market fund designed to serve as yield-bearing collateral for trading, lending, and borrowing; Hashnote Harbor, a solution that allows clients to earn yield without moving funds out of custody; and the CD20, a professionally managed index product that provides long exposure.

2. Key personnel biographies:

Leo Mizuhara | CEO & Founder

Leo spent 12 years at Bank of America, eventually departing as Managing Director managing the bank’s assets and liabilities as part of Corporate Investments. From there he spent five years running Fixed Income Currencies and Commodities Systematic Options Trading at DRW before launching Hashnote with DRW’s support.

Dave Shapiro | Chief Technology Officer

David has been an entrepreneur for the past 14 years. Before Hashnote, David Co-founded and led product and engineering as CTO of Scout Security (IPO ASX), a security-focused IoT firm. Later he served as VP of Engineering at Latch Inc (IPO NASDAQ).

Andrew Ridenour | Chief Regulatory Officer and General Counsel

Experienced regulator and in-house counsel, with an emphasis on derivatives and blockchain incubation as Special Counsel to the CFTC Chair, General Counsel at Cumberland Labs, and Institutional Counsel at Coinbase.

Kat Daminova | Director of Business Development EMEA

Kat leads business development at Hashnote for the EMEA region, with over a decade of experience in traditional finance, fintech, and digital assets. Before Hashnote, she held key roles at Gemini and was Head of Product at Copper. She has launched investment products across asset classes and developed software solutions, with notable positions at Goldman Sachs, UBS, and Leonteq.

3. Team size: ~12 people

4. Years in operation: ~2

III. Product Information

1. Describe the product: USYC earns short-term risk-free rate returns. Our clients, upon successfully completing KYC/AML, can instantly mint and redeem USYC into their whitelisted wallets 24/7 from USDC and PYUSD. USYC can also be minted and redeemed into USDT and fiat. The token is available as Ethereum ERC20, NEAR, BASE and will soon be integrated with Axelar.

2. Describe the underlying asset: USYC is the on-chain representation of Hashnote’s regulated International Short Duration Yield Fund (iSDYF). iSDYF uses its prime broker Marex and custodian BNY Mellon to invest cash into overnight reverse-repo to ensure minimised market risk, duration risk, and credit risk. Whether the investor chooses to purchase with fiat or stablecoin, the amount of USYC the investor receives is equal to the deposit amount divided by the current price of USYC. Hashnote mints into the investor’s wallet an amount of USYC tokens equivalent to the number of shares the investor has in the iSDYF.

3. How is yield transferred to the tokenholder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often? We update the price of the token daily to reflect the yield that has been earned overnight.

4. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities? Hashnote International Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd (iSDYF), a mutual fund providing the USYC product, is domiciled in the Cayman Islands.

It is managed by its investment manager, Hasnote Management LLC, a United States limited liability company formed in Delaware.

We adhere to strict regulations, ensuring our operations meet institutional investment standards.

5. What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents? Our PPM permits investment into T Bills but currently we only invest into reverse repo.

6. Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio? No we don’t do any hedging; however, reverse repo can be described as a derivative product.

7. Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

  • Custodian: Bank of NY Mellon
  • Liquidity Provider: Cumberland DRW LLC
  • Prime Broker: Marex Capital Markets Inc.
  • Fund Administrator; KYC Services: NAV Fund Services (Cayman) Ltd.
  • AML Service Provider: LMO Consulting Pte. Ltd.
  • Wallet Screening Services: Godwin Austen Advisory Pte. Ltd.
  • Auditor: Cohen & Co International
  • Bank: Customers Bank
  • MPC wallet: Fireblocks

8. What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain. AUM of the product is over $260mm, live data here: USYC | Hashnote

Chain Breakdown:

  • Ethereum $250+mm
  • Canto $3.5mm
  • NEAR $2.5mm
  • BASE …coming…

9. What are the standard fees (i.e., subscription, redemption, management, etc.)?

  • Subscription Fee: None for fiat, PYUSD and USDC // 0.10% for USDT
  • Redemption Fee: None for fiat, PYUSD and USDT // 0.10% for USDC
  • Performance Fee: 10% of Yield.

10. Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets? Hashnote charges performance fees via an inflationary minting of USYC tokens.

11. How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users) USYC is a permissioned token that requires investors to undergo KYC/AML verification with Hashnote for both primary and secondary trading. Once an investor is onboarded, their wallet address is whitelisted, granting them permission to hold and transfer USYC. The smart contract will simply not allow mints or transfers of USYC into non-whitelisted wallet addresses.

12. What is the monthly transaction volume for the product? ~$300 million in the last month

13. What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions? Users can expect instant atomic on-chain 24/7 minting and redemptions into USDC and PUYSD 24/7 via Hashnote’s “Teller” smart contract.

Alternatively, onboarded users can use a “manual” method with fiat, USDC, USDT or PUYSD, T+0 or T+1. Redemptions made before 2:00 pm ET are processed by 5:00 pm ET the same day. Redemptions made after 2:00 pm ET are processed by 11:00 am ET the next day.

Hashnote has never had any service interruption for redemptions or subscriptions.

14. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved. USYC can be obtained by onboarded investors through the Web3 smart contract method or the traditional method.

Web3 Smart Contract Method

Minting is available 24/7. Burning is available whenever contract amounts permit. Hashnote refills PYUSD teller at least once per business day to maintain instant redemption availability.

Subscription

  1. Go to the USYC Portal (usyc.hashnote.com)
  2. Connect your wallet to the Smart Contract Teller
  3. On the “Fund” tab, select the appropriate stablecoin (PYUSD or USDC) you wish to use for minting USYC and enter a deposit amount
  4. Enter the amount of USYC you wish to mint
  5. Click “Add Funds” to instantly deposit stablecoin and mint USYC into your designated whitelisted wallet at the price shown

Redemption

  1. Go to the USYC Portal (usyc.hashnote.com)
  2. Connect your wallet to the Smart Contract Teller
  3. On the “Redeem” tab, select the stablecoin you wish to receive (PYUSD or USDC)
  4. Enter the amount of USYC you wish to redeem
  5. Click “Redeem Funds” to burn USYC at the price shown and receive the selected stablecoin in your wallet

Traditional Method

Subscription and Redemption are available on US Business Days. Redemptions made before 2:00 pm ET are processed by 5:00 pm ET the same day. Redemptions made after 2:00 pm ET are processed by 11:00 am ET the next day.

Subscription

  1. Send stablecoin (PYUSD, USDC, or USDT) to Hashnote Short Duration Yield Fund (SDYF) wallet
  2. Notify a Hashnote representative
  3. Receive minted USYC in your designated whitelisted wallet

Redemption

  1. Send USYC to Hashnote SDYF wallet or burn USYC directly on-chain
  2. Notify a Hashnote representative
  3. Receive stablecoin or fiat

*Subscription

*Redemption

15. Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work. To help investors enter and exit their positions efficiently, we provide a Smart Contract Teller to facilitate investing in the fund and liquidating the asset on-chain. The Smart Contract Teller allows the client to have up to 100% instant liquidity into PYUSD at all times. Our market maker Cumberland can support additional liquidity and facilitate redemptions 24/7.

16. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.) Onboarded clients can see the deposit address in their Hashnote portal. Hashnote will accept PUYSD, USDT, USDC or fiat as subscription and redemption assets. Upon acceptance as MakerDAO collateral, Hashnote will make DAI a redemption asset.

17. What are your future development plans for the product? We aim to enable instant, 24/7 minting and redemption of USYC into more stablecoins. USYC stands out from the rest of the tokenized RWAs as it finds its application across the digital asset ecosystem as a whole. As a treasury management tool and an alternative to holding stablecoins we are already backing the Usual stablecoin. As a collateral token used by custodians, centralised and decentralised exchanges, USYC boosts liquidity and collateral efficiency for trading, borrowing, and lending. To expand its reach, we are forming new partnerships, bridging to more chains, and adding market makers. By 2025, we plan to be available on multiple venues and currently adding more market makers.

IV. Legal Structure

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates Hashnote International Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd (iSDYF), a mutual fund providing the USYC product, is domiciled in the Cayman Islands. It is managed by its investment manager, Hasnote Management LLC, a United States limited liability company formed in Delaware.

What regulatory bodies oversee the product? Regulated by the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) and Cayman Island Monetary Authority (CIMA)

2. What licences, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, exemptions does your product or company hold? Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd (iSDYF), a mutual fund providing the USYC product is regulated by the Cayman Islands Monetary Authority (CIMA). Hashnote Management LLC is registered as a Commodity Pool Operator (CPO) and Commodity Trading Advisor (CTA) with the National Futures Association (NFA), and it is regulated by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC).

3. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness All investments in the iSDYF fund are held in a bankruptcy-remote structure at our custodian, BNY Mellon, through our prime broker, Marex. iSDYF is a Cayman Islands mutual fund, and any resolution of the iSDYF fund would be independent of any potential resolution or bankruptcy involving Hashnote. Nearly all assets of the iSDYF fund are maintained in its prime brokerage account at Marex Capital Markets, a registered broker-dealer.

4. What rights do token holders have? Investors holding USYC are shareholders in the iSDYF fund and have redemption rights to their underlying shares in iSDYF under Cayman Islands law. When investors subscribe to iSDYF, they receive participating shares at the current price for that day. Shareholders, including the DAO, have rights to the fund’s assets under Cayman Islands bankruptcy law.

5. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers? Hashnote and its officers have never been subjected to a criminal or legal enforcement action.

6. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO We have no conflicts of interest with MakerDAO or its officers.

7. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product Although we cannot offer any tax advice, generally, if there is no US-connected income for the user, iSDYF does not create any US tax income obligations.

V. Performance, Reporting, and Technical

1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark The token is interest accruing. This means the price of the token increases each business day. USYC is not a rebasing token.

2. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these? Live monitoring and reporting is provided to the public on our transparency page at https://usyc.hashnote.com/ and is always available via Etherscan.

We are also currently onboarding with the Chainlink Proof of Reserve to enable the reliable and timely monitoring of reserve assets. Jiritsu is also working on proof of reserves reports for USYC.

3. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product The daily price of USYC is set internally by Hashnote at 7 am Eastern, based on the Net Asset Value (NAV) of the Prime Brokerage account divided by the total USYC supply. NAV Fund Services (Cayman) Ltd manages the accounting, tracking on-chain activity to update the share registry. Cohen & Co International audits the fund’s books and records to validate year-end statements.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product Here’s a summary of the USYC infrastructure, which focuses on scalability, security, and compliance:

On-Chain Overview:

Flexible smart contracts allow for upgrades, with key functions like minting, burning, and managing the Entitlements securely controlled by Hashnote to maintain compliance.

  • Entitlements Investors who pass KYC/AML checks have their wallet addresses receive entitlements, enabling them to interact with USYC. Entitlements are the gatekeepers to most of the functionality of USYC. The wallets associated with KYC’ed entities receive a Role that entitles them to mint, hold, transfer, and burn the token.The USYC Smart Contracts queries the Entitlements contract to verify the caller of a transaction has the appropriate permissions to perform a transaction.

In addition to checking that a wallet is permissioned, the Entitlements contract also performs OFAC sanctions checks by querying an on-chain oracle for matches to sanctioned addresses. The oracle is maintained by Chainalysis.

  • Minting & Burning Hashnote mints new USYC tokens when investors subscribe manually (via Fiat or stables). Investors can burn their tokens or submit a request to Hashnote to initiate redemption.

Tellers offer 24/7 subscriptions and redemption capability. Redemptions are subject to liquidity (see Teller section for more details)

  • Transfers & Oracle USYC tokens can be transferred between whitelisted addresses, and asset prices are regularly updated via an Oracle feed. Prices are reported once per business day.
usyc.docs.hashnote.com

Token Price | USYC

Additional Technical Products and Services:

  • Onboarding Tool: A proprietary tool simplifies investor onboarding for a seamless experience.
  • Investor Portal: Provides real time portfolio information such as NAV, token holdings, and historical transactions.
  • Fireblocks: Hashnote utilizes MPC wallets managed via Fireblocks to secure admin controls, transaction approvals, and other on-chain operations.
  • Internal Reconciliation & Public Website: Daily reconciliation ensures accuracy, while the public website provides key information on yield and NAV for investors.

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when? Hashnote has engaged several independent auditors to review our smart contracts. The audits have been completed by Sentnl and ChainSafe as well as an independent security researcher Anton Cheng.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs We submitted an application to MakerDao offering USYC instead of WBTC addressing the community’s risk concerns.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem? Hashnote is approaching Maker with longevity and stability and mind, and we believe that introducing Hashnote USYC is fully aligned with “The Endgame Plan” proposed by Rune Christensen.

  1. Integrating Hashnote USYC supports this strategy by increasing the share of Real-World Assets (RWA) as collateral, thereby reducing dependence on USDC and significantly improving the profit and loss margin of MakerDAO. Dai can best scale its usage and maintain its peg by issuing against non-correlated, yield bearing, and reliable assets.
  2. A strategic partnership with Hashnote expands Maker growth opportunities by tapping into a larger and more stable addressable market: professional and institutional crypto investors and tradfi community alike. Unlike other yield-bearing tokens, Hashnote USYC use-case goes beyond treasury management savings vehicle. USYC is designed and is growing to be the universally accepted collateral token accepted by centralised and decentralised exchanges as well as lending and custody providers and further down the line should be introduced to venues like CME to further enhance collateral efficiency in the tradfi space.
  3. Through this strategic partnership, Hashnote community and its stakeholders are likely to be attracted to Spark, which would positively impact the growth of SparkLend. Hashnote is actively working on launching multiple lending products in collaboration with centralised venues, attracting professional investors and large institutional clients. We anticipate that this will bring a similar user base to the MakerDAO ecosystem, positioning it as a gateway into DeFi for users who haven’t explored DeFi yet.
  4. Hashnote fully addresses and safeguards the concerns of the Maker community while ensuring legal recognition of their assets. The Hashnote team comes with extensive experience in traditional finance and aims to leverage the transparency and credibility offered by blockchain technology to bridge the gap between on-chain and off-chain asset representations.
  5. With Hashnote’s expertise in tokenization, Maker Governance can gain a powerful gateway to engage in “real-world” activities. We fully agree that DeFi requires a foundational layer of collateral anchored to more stable, secular supply and demand dynamics, and RWAs are a crucial step toward achieving this vision.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms? Morpho is a lending protocol that enhances capital efficiency by optimising yields on lending pools. Hashnote USYC serves as collateral on the Morpho platform for the Steakhouse PYUSD vault, making it the key venue for borrowing and lending PYUSD on Ethereum mainnet and offering one of the most efficient environments for PYUSD lending.

This partnership allows users to earn higher yields compared to traditional DeFi lending protocols by leveraging the stability and potential returns of tokenized Real-World Assets (RWAs). Additionally, the collaboration attracts institutional clients to DeFi by combining Morpho’s efficient lending mechanisms with Hashnote’s regulated, tokenized products, providing a strong value proposition for large-scale investors.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs? Yes, Hashnote is a diversified asset manager that continuously launches new products. We are always exploring opportunities to offer innovative solutions that could be suitable for Spark or other SubDAOs. As we develop new offerings, we will actively engage with the DAO to understand their specific needs and collaborate on potential opportunities.

Thank you for your attention.
