item.title: Tokenization Grand Prix Application - Matrixdock STBT
item.dc:creator: matrixdock
item.description:
I. Product Summary

1. Project Name: Matrixdock
2. Product Name: Short-Term Treasury Bill Token (STBT)
3. Product Type / Underlying Asset:

STBT is backed by a combination of the following instruments

  • Short term US Treasury bills (with maturities of 3 months or less)
  • Reverse Repurchase Agreements collateralized with US Treasuries
  • BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL)

4. Issuer Jurisdiction: Seychelles
5. Product Website: https://www.matrixdock.com/stbt
6. Primary Contact name, title, and method of contact

Name: Josh Wu
Title: Matrixdock BD
Email: josh.ng@matrixport.com
Telegram: @mrjoshwu

Name: Jamie Wang
Title: Matrixdock BD
Email: jamie.wang@matrixport.com
Telegram: @jamie_web3

II. Company Details

1. Company description

Matrixdock, founded in 2022, is the RWA technology division of Matrixport, a leading digital asset management firm from Asia. As part of the Matrixport Group, we are dedicated to bringing the highest quality real-world assets on-chain, empowering users with secure and efficient access through our transparent and innovative infrastructure.

Our flagship product, STBT (tokenized Short-Term Treasury Bill), reflects our commitment to excellence. Matrixdock leverages the expertise and infrastructure of Matrixport to deliver cutting-edge solutions for real-world asset tokenization. We are committed to offering high-quality RWA products and services to the market, ensuring our solutions meet the needs of decentralized ecosystems with security, transparency, and efficiency.

Matrixport, established in 2019, has a proven track record of navigating economic uncertainty and crypto cycles. With over US$6B in assets under management, Matrixport provides comprehensive services beyond asset management, including custody, brokerage, and OTC services. The company has a strong presence across Singapore, Hong Kong, Taiwan, and Thailand, catering to a global clientele that includes miners, high-net-worth individuals, family offices, hedge funds, ventures, protocols, and foundations.

Learn more about Matrixdock here.

2. Key personnel biographies

Eva Meng, Head of Matrixdock

Eva is a seasoned blockchain expert with extensive experience, having served as the Director of Bitdeer Group (NASDAQ: BTDR) and CEO of BTC.COM, a subsidiary of BIT Mining Group (NYSE: BTCM). She has played a key role in advancing blockchain infrastructure and mining technologies on a global scale.

Since 2022, Eva has been at the forefront of innovation in Real World Assets (RWA), pioneering PoR-backed tokenized treasuries and multi-chain stablecoins. Prior to Matrixdock, Eva has 10+ years of experience leading operations at top Internet and Gaming companies.

Seth Yan, Head of Strategy (Matrixdock)

Seth has extensive experiences in bridging digital currencies with real world goods and services across APAC. Previously, he was EVP leading Digital Financial Services and Innovation at a leading Consumer Internet platform in Southeast Asia. Seth holds a PhD in Information Engineering from Nanyang Technological University of Singapore.

Christopher Liu, Chief Compliance Officer and Head of Regulatory

Chris has over 20 years of experience in financial services, fintech and blockchain securities. Chris leads Matrixport Group’s global regulatory and compliance practice, notably working closely with Hong Kong and Singapore regulators to secure virtual asset licensing in both markets.

Previously, Chris was Head of Compliance at Razer (e-Money & Payments), Wallex (Payments), and led Citibank’s Asia and EMEA AML programs for its Consumer Group.

Rohit Apte, Head of Trading

As Head of Trading, Rohit leads the trade desk with focus on Matrixport’s tokenized U.S. Treasury Bills offering – the Short-term Treasury Bill Token (STBT). Rohit has over 18 years of experience in trading across TradFi and cryptocurrency markets. Prior to venturing into crypto, Rohit was APAC Co-Head of G10 rates trading at HSBC.

Dr. Kyle Wang, Technical Lead

Dr. Wang leads Matrixport’s blockchain research and engineering teams, bringing extensive experience in blockchain development. As one of Bitcoin mining and crypto’s OGs, he was CTO for SmartBCH, a sidechain of Bitcoin Cash (FDV $6.7B) - he also held key technical roles at Bitmain (2016-2019) and CoinEx Chain (2019-2020). He attained his Ph.D. in Computer Architecture from Peking University in 2009.

3. Team size

~20 members

4. Years in operation

Matrixdock, a subsidiary of Matrixport established in 2022, is dedicated to bringing high-quality real-world assets on-chain.

Matrixport, founded in 2018, has built a strong reputation over the past six years as a leading digital asset financial services platform. It is recognized for its innovative solutions and strong market presence, delivering a broad range of services in the digital asset space. Matrixdock leverages this expertise to bridge traditional finance and DeFi, making real-world assets accessible through blockchain technology.

III. Product Information

1. Describe the product

Matrixdock Short-term Treasury Bill Token (STBT) is designed for accredited investors seeking exposure to US treasury yields. STBT is the first tokenized T-bill token issued in Asia, and currently yields approximately 5.10-5.30% APY on average (gross yield including fees, as of Aug 2024).

Each STBT is pegged to 1 USD and is collateralized by a combination of the following instruments

  • Short term US Treasury bills (with maturities of 3 months or less)
  • Reverse Repurchase Agreements collateralized with US Treasuries
  • BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL)

Matrixdock sources from a wide range of independent sources to ensure diversification. Allocations are made dynamically to optimize for stability and liquidity.

STBT is an ERC-1400 token that distributes yield on a daily basis via re-basing, with T+1 minting and T+0 redemption. T+0 redemption is supported directly by Matrixdock and in secondary venues such as Curve.

STBT is also the first to accept multiple stablecoins as deposit and redemption options, and the first to accept minting with DAI directly.

For STBT, Matrixdock works closely with Chainlink to deliver the best UX on DeFi

  • Proof of Reserves: STBT is the market’s first tokenized treasury token adopting Chainlink’s Proof of Reserves, enforcing the number of tokens minted is always less than or equal to the underlying NAV by smart contract, assuring investor confidence on-chain.
  • Data feed: STBT NAV data is recorded publicly on-chain and verified by Chainlink’s decentralized oracle network
  • CCIP: STBT is multi-chain enabled, available on Ethereum and Arbitrum.

STBT is also committed to driving innovation in token utility. It serves as collateral for borrowing and lending, as well as for leveraging on selected platforms in both DeFi and CeFi, including Term Finance and bit.com.

2. Describe the underlying asset

US Treasuries are considered the safest USD-denominated asset. STBT is built upon a basket of on-chain and off-chain instruments, which include

  • Short term US Treasury bills (with maturities of 3 months or less)
  • Reverse Repurchase Agreements collateralized with US Treasuries
  • BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL)

The inclusion of on-chain assets is designed to enhance liquidity and provide added flexibility to the portfolio, complementing the stability of off-chain assets. Based on Matrixdock’s professional asset management experience, allocations are made dynamically to optimize for product yield, stability and liquidity. A small amount of cash is kept to facilitate basic liquidity needs.

3. How is yield transferred to the token holder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

Matrixdock distributes yield daily through the rebase of STBT in holders token balances. STBT is pegged to 1 USD, and total STBT supply is increased to reflect increasing NAV.

Total STBT supply is equivalent to the Net Asset Value (NAV) of the underlying asset portfolio, which equates to the sum of the market value of US T-bills, reverse repos, BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL) and cash.

4. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?

STBT adopts a bankruptcy remote SPV structure, where issuer and custodian are separate entities with token holders owning complete legal rights to claim against custodied assets, to ensure 100% fund segregation and investor protection for all token holders.

Trust: Prometheus Solutions Purpose Trust (Seychelles)

Issuer: Prometheus Solutions Ltd (Seychelles)

Custodian: Epimetheus Technologies SPC (Cayman)

Enforcer/Protector: Hamilton Services Limited (United Kingdom)

Brokers: StoneX (United States), UBS (United Kingdom), Securitize (United States - for BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL) by BlackRock)

5. What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents?

Matrixdock sources T-bills from multiple sources off-chain and on-chain. Based on extensive professional asset management experience, Matrixdock allocates dynamically based on asset characteristics to optimise for yield, stability and liquidity.

Asset eligibility: Only assets that are US Treasuries within 3 month maturities, tokens representing US Treasuries, Repos and Cash are eligible for STBT.

Currently, STBT accepts the following assets

  • Short term US Treasury bills (with maturities of 3 months or less)
  • Reverse Repurchase Agreements collateralized with US Treasuries
  • BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL)

6. Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio?

No, the use of hedging or derivatives is not permitted. The underlying portfolio only accepts

  • Short term US Treasury bills (with maturities of 3 months or less)
  • Reverse Repurchase Agreements collateralized with US Treasuries
  • BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL)

A small amount of cash is kept to facilitate basic liquidity needs.

7. Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

STBT adopts a bankruptcy remote SPV structure, where issuer and custodian are separate entities with token holders owning complete legal rights to claim against custodied assets, to ensure 100% fund segregation and investor protection for all token holders.

Matrixdock works with the following list of partners:

Trust: Prometheus Solutions Purpose Trust (Seychelles)

Issuer: Prometheus Solutions Ltd (Seychelles)

Custodian: Epimetheus Technologies SPC (Cayman)

Enforcer/Protector: Hamilton Services Limited (United Kingdom)

Brokers: StoneX (United States), UBS (United Kingdom), Securitize (United States - for BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund)

Oracle Provider: Harris & Trotter (United Kingdom), Chainlink (United States)

USDC Services: Circle Internet Financial

OTC: Matrixport

DEX: Curve

8. What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain

$41,994,992.55 as of 03 Sep 2024 (historical highest TVL $123.6M on 22 Aug 2023), blockchain breakdown as below

  • Ethereum: $41,984,992.55
  • Arbitrum: $10,000.00

Please refer to STBT Dune Dashboard for more details.

9. What are the standard fees (i.e., subscription, redemption, management, etc.)?

Matrixdock is committed to delivering consistent yields while ensuring the security and independence of its underlying assets. We continuously strive to enhance the quality of our offerings to meet users’ liquidity needs, all while maintaining competitive and reasonable fees.

Our focus remains on optimizing efficiency and stability to provide a superior user experience, balancing risk management with the pursuit of value.

Parameters Fees
Custodian fee 0.35%
Management fee 0.00% (waived until 1 Feb 2025, resume to 0.15% after)
Minting fee 0.00%
Redemption fee 0.00%

The above custodian fee is annual, prorated and charged on a daily basis. The increase in custodian fees from Sept 10th 2024 reflects an expansion in our custody partners to improve STBT liquidity. To complement this update, Matrixdock has waived redemption fees.

Fees are automatically subtracted from the daily yield distribution that STBT holders receive.

10. Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets?

There are no additional fees outside of the ones described above. Expenses are accrued on a daily basis and reflected in the Fund’s NAV, enabling easy calculation of return net fees.

11. How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users)

STBT is an ERC-1400 token, designed to represent security tokens for compliant and legal transactions. To ensure regulatory compliance, the U.S. market is not open for this product.

STBT uses a whitelisting mechanism where all users must pass Matrixdock’s Accredited Investor KYC process to become eligible. Only whitelisted addresses and users can mint, redeem, transfer, and hold the STBT token. Whitelisted users can also add additional wallet addresses via the STBT website by signing an on-chain transaction or conducting a satoshi test.

12. What is the monthly transaction volume for the product?

The volume of transactions in the last twelve months is over $800M (including deposits, redemptions, on-chain transactions), which equates to an average monthly transaction volume of $60M/month.

13. What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions?

STBT Parameters
Minting
Minimum mint US$100,000
Processing time T+1, for any amount
Redemption
Minimum redemption US$50,000
Processing time For moderate amounts: T+0; No limit on amounts: T+2

Alternatively, for small amounts, users may also redeem by swapping on Curve’s STBT-3pool (supports USDC/USDT/DAI)|

Important Disclaimer on Redemption Periods and Liquidity

Matrixdock has always prioritized enhancing the user experience while adapting to the evolving needs of the DeFi community. However, recognizing the importance of instant redemption for DeFi Treasury management, we continuously improved our processes.

We’re proud to announce that, starting September 14th, 2024, STBT will support T+0 instant redemptions. This progression from T+4 to T+2 to T+0 highlights our unwavering commitment to delivering the most efficient and responsive service in the DeFi space.

(For reference, we proposed longer redemption periods previously - T+4 on Arbitrum and T+2 on Ethena).

Deep Liquidity Assurance

Over the past 12 months, Matrixdock has seamlessly processed up to $50M in redemptions within the T+2 period, maintaining an impeccable record of fulfilling every request on time. This flawless performance, with zero redemption delays or faults since inception, reflects our dedication to reliability and precision.

Our proven liquidity management and commitment to user satisfaction reinforce our position as a leader in the DeFi space, consistently delivering the highest standards of service and dependability to our partners and users.

14. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved.

Flow of funds

Matrixdock supports minting and redemption in USDC, USDT and DAI.

Minting

There are multiple routes for minting STBT. The user can either;

  1. Submit OTC request and send stablecoins to designated deposit address
  2. Deposit eligible ERC20 stablecoin on Matrixdock Web App
  3. Swap on STBT Curve-3pool

For large quantities ($1M+), we recommend option 1. After receiving the deposit, the STBT Issuer converts stablecoin into USD and transfers it to the Custodian’s bank / broker account. Once the T-bill order is confirmed, STBT NAV is updated, concurrently STBT is minted and sent to the user’s whitelisted wallet address.

Proof of Reserves: STBT users are assured that every STBT minted is backed by at least 1 USD of real assets - enforced by smart contract safeguards using Chainlink Oracles and NAV data feeds.

Redemptions

Similarly, the user has multiple routes for redeeming STBT.

  1. Submit OTC request
  2. Use the swap widget on Matrixdock Web App
  3. Swap on STBT Curve-3pool

Once the Issuer receives the redemption request from the user, open T-bill / repo positions are closed and settled. After bank/broker confirmation, the settled USD is converted into eligible ERC 20 stablecoins. STBT is burned and stablecoins are transferred to the user’s whitelisted address.

Please refer to the graphic below for fund flow.

15. Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work.

Primary liquidity

As mentioned above, Matrixdock adopts a hybrid allocation approach to optimize for STBT yield, stability and liquidity. Matrixdock has partnered with the BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL) to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency - supporting T+1 minting and T+0 redemptions.

For instant redemption, redeemed STBT are swapped into the BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL) on-chain then into USDC (rather than settled off-chain from T-bills).

Secondary liquidity

Currently, Matrixdock supports a $3M STBT-3pool on Curve to facilitate immediate swaps.

One advantage with Matrixdock is its established network of relationships with liquidity providers, market makers and institutions. Matrixdock has a proven track record of supporting significant single day redemptions of up to $50M even outside market hours.

16. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.)

Matrixdock supports USDC, USDT and DAI for subscriptions and redemptions. Fiat is also accepted, subject to OTC terms and fees. Matrixdock can also support licensed legally-compliant third party OTCs.

Matrixdock acknowledges that MakerDao has rebranded into Sky, and will be upgrading DAI to USDS. With a successful DeFi treasury allocation, Matrixdock can accelerate USDS support within the Matrixport ecosystem and directly as a subscription/redemption currency for STBT.

17. What are your future development plans for the product?

STBT is increasingly being used in treasury management by institutional investors and DAOs.

For future development, Matrixdock will focus on four fronts

i. Greater Efficiencies:

By partnering with top-tier custodians, Matrixdock will enhance operational efficiency, reduce costs, and mitigate risk. This global approach ensures that our assets are safeguarded across multiple jurisdictions, delivering superior security standards while optimizing asset management processes.

ii. More Diverse User Base:

Matrixdock will grow the STBT user base by forming strategic partnerships with top-tier institutional platforms and digital exchanges. As the user base expands, the whitelist pool will grow, allowing more users to transact with each other. This whitelisting mechanism ensures that only approved users can hold and trade STBT tokens within the secure, compliant ecosystem. By broadening the pool of whitelisted users, we aim to enhance the liquidity and accessibility of STBT, fostering a more dynamic and diverse marketplace. By expanding the network of compliant users, Matrixdock aims to foster collaboration and unlock additional growth potential within the ecosystem.

iii. Deeper Liquidity:

Matrixdock is committed to deepening liquidity by increasing partnerships with top liquidity providers and market makers. Additionally, we plan to scale our Curve pool and raise transaction caps, ensuring seamless liquidity, even during periods of heightened demand.

iv. Greater DeFi Utility:

To expand DeFi utility, Matrixdock plans to integrate STBT with leading decentralized protocols, positioning it as a strong collateral option for lending and perpetual markets. Additionally, we envision STBT being used as an underlying asset for other innovative products, such as yield-generating strategies and structured financial instruments, further enhancing its versatility and value across the DeFi ecosystem.

IV. Legal Structure

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates

Trust and Asset Management Structure

Matrix Finance and Technologies Holding Company

  • Role: Choosing the trustee, designating the beneficiaries, and setting the specific terms of the trust.
  • Jurisdiction: Cayman Islands

Appleby Global Services (Seychelles) Limited

  • Role: Managing and distributing the trust assets as specified in the trust agreement.
  • Jurisdiction: Seychelles

Hamilton Services Limited

  • Role: Ensures that the trustee manages the trust assets according to the trust’s purpose and terms.
  • Jurisdiction: Seychelles

Prometheus Solutions Ltd. (Seychelles)

  • Role: Issuer of the STBT token.
  • Jurisdiction: Seychelles

Epimetheus Technologies SPC

  • Role: Holding assets, including investments in T-bills, Repo, BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL), and cash.
  • Jurisdiction: Cayman Islands

2. What regulatory bodies oversee the product?

The structure is fully compliant with the Seychelles regulatory framework, which governs the issuance of the STBT token. Furthermore, no U.S. entities or users are involved.

3. What licenses, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, exemptions does your product or company hold?

Matrixport’s Existing Licenses:

  • Trust or Company Service Provider (TCSP) – Hong Kong
  • Money Lender – Hong Kong
  • Self-Regulatory Organization (SRO) – Switzerland
  • Appointed Representative (AR) – United Kingdom
  • Money Services Business (MSB) – United States

These licenses are held by Matrixport to facilitate its global operations in compliance with financial regulations across multiple jurisdictions. As a subsidiary of Matrixport Group, Matrixdock can leverage these licenses to enhance its own operations and regulatory capabilities, ensuring smooth and compliant business activities.

Matrixport’s Exemptions:

  • Virtual Asset Trading Platform (VATP)/Hong Kong
  • Major Payment Institution - Digital Payment Token Service and Custody/ Singapore

Licenses Under Application from Matrixport:

  • Virtual Asset Service Provider/British Virgin Island
  • Virtual Asset Service Provider/Cayman Island
  • Capital Markets Services - Custody Services/Singapore

We can provide detailed information regarding the relevant licenses via email to support your review process.

4. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness

The orphan trust structure effectively separates the STBT entities (both the token issuer and asset holder) from Matrixdock’s balance sheet. This means that, even in the unlikely event of Matrixdock’s insolvency, the assets held by the STBT entities would remain fully protected and would not be subject to any claims from Matrixdock’s creditors.

The STBT entities are designed as special purpose vehicles (SPVs) that exclusively manage the STBT program. These entities incur no liabilities other than their obligations to STBT token holders, which are their sole focus. Additionally, the number of STBT tokens issued will always be less than the value of the underlying reserves held by these entities.

With these safeguards in place, the STBT entities are considered bankruptcy remote, ensuring maximum security for token holders. This legal structure provides a robust level of protection, isolating the assets backing the STBT tokens from any potential risks associated with Matrixdock.

For further details about these entities, please feel free to request additional information via email.

5. What rights do token holders have?

Holders of STBT tokens have a right to a debt obligation from the token issuer. Each STBT token is redeemable for an amount equivalent to one U.S. dollar, minus any applicable fees, trading losses, or transactional costs. The redemption value reflects the pro rata value of the underlying assets at the time of redemption.

When you redeem your STBT tokens, the amount you receive will be based on the value of the underlying assets at that time, after accounting for any necessary fees and costs associated with the sale of these assets. Please note that there may be additional redemption restrictions that apply.

6. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers?

No, there are no pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers.

7. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO

Not applicable.

8. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product

STBT is subject to taxation at the user’s applicable tax rate, which depends on the user’s jurisdiction and legal setup. Primary tax consequences originate from redemption.

Users are responsible for fulfilling their tax obligations and advised to consult a tax advisor. Matrixdock may assist in connecting relevant tax advisors if needed.

V. Performance, Reporting, and Technical

1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark

STBT has historically yielded approximately 4.8-5.0% APY post fees, or 5.1-5.3% pre fees. Our performance tracks closely with the Federal Funds Rate with little to no deviation. (FFR Effective Federal Funds Rate - FEDERAL RESERVE BANK of NEW YORK)

The average APR per month post fees, year to date is presented in the table below.

Month Average APY
Jan 2024 5.15%
Feb 2024 4.98%
Mar 2024 4.97%
Apr 2024 4.98%
May 2024 4.96%
Jun 2024 4.95%
Jul 2024 4.80%

2. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these?

Daily underlying asset reports are made available for download on the STBT Underlying Assets website.

It is a PDF document that combines the daily statements of bank and broker statements, which represent the net-asset value of all assets backing STBT.

3. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product

STBT is the first RWA tokenization project integrated with Chainlink’s Proof-of-Reserve (PoR). This integration ensures that STBT is sufficiently backed by US Treasury securities and verifiable 24/7. PoR safeguards user funds by enforcing mint < NAV via smart contract, this is coded into the STBT contract itself.

Harris & Trotter are responsible for uploading NAV data on-chain for verification by Chainlink’s decentralized network of oracles.

STBT PoR feed can be found here.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product

Smart Contract Framework

The permission framework of the STBT contract is broadly classified into three distinct roles: ControllerRole, IssuerRole, ModeratorRole. The proposal is to designate a single smart contract with a timelock function as the controller contract for all three roles. All STBT administrator activities are carried out via this controller contract, with each operation subject to two stages of proposing and executing, and the execution must conform to the delay specified by the timelock. The overall structure is as follows:

Timelock contract: There is a single external control smart contract with a timelock function as the controller contract, through which all STBT administrator activities are carried out. Each operation must go through two stages of proposing and executing, with execution conforming to the 4-hour delay specified by the timelock.

The timelock contract is the only admin, and the security of the STBT contract is normalized to the security of each role involved in the timelock controller: proposer, executor, and canceller. The canceller is one self-hosted hardware wallet that is authorized to cancel an operation scheduled during the timelock period by calling the timelock controller.

Token Standard

ERC1400 standard is split into several modular sub-standards：

  • ERC1410 defines partially fungible tokens where balances of tokens can have an associated metadata
  • ERC1594 defines transfer restrictions and core security token functionality
  • ERC1643 defines document management functionality.
  • ERC1644 defines controller operation functionality

In particular, the STBT token contract implements the ERC1594 transfer restrictions specs, and the ERC1644 controller operations specs. STBT utilizes the whitelist mechanism to determine whether transmission and reception of addresses are authorized.

STBT Risk Mitigation and Monitoring

STBT mitigates contract and operational risks through the implementation of a whitelist mechanism, time-lock contracts, and an independent real-time monitoring system, ensuring the highest level of safety and security.

In order to further prevent operational and hacking risks, Matrixdock has implemented two separated sets of monitoring systems:

A. The first system monitors the difference between the business order data and the contract activity data to detect any unauthorized minting of STBT tokens. Any suspicious activity can be immediately canceled, and emergency plans activated.

B. The second system monitors the difference between the confirmation fiat wiring amount and the contract activity data. This monitoring service is independently maintained and monitored to identify any anomaly.

The STBT minter contract only allows whitelisted wallets to call this contract directly and mint/redeem STBT. In this way, all key actions initiated through the minter contract, such as Mint, Burn, Settle, will be transparently tracked on-chain, ensuring full transparency and allowing for the tracking of all capital flows and information related to the transactions.

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?

STBT’s smart contract has been audited by BlockSec (Jan 2023) and Zellic.io (Feb 2023). Audit reports can be found here.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs

While Matrixdock itself has not yet engaged directly with MakerDAO in formal partnerships, our parent company, Matrixport, has a deep-rooted history in the crypto and blockchain space. Matrixport’s extensive experience in managing complex crypto financial products and infrastructure has provided Matrixdock with valuable insights into the operational dynamics of decentralized platforms. Over the years, Matrixport has maintained a positive relationship with MakerDAO, entering exploratory discussions on multiple fronts, including but not limited to Real-World Assets (RWA).

Recognizing MakerDAO’s significant influence in the DeFi space, we have made the strategic decision to accept DAI as the token for minting STBT. This decision underscores our commitment to aligning with MakerDAO’s ecosystem and catering to its extensive user base.

With our team’s expertise in navigating both traditional finance and digital assets, we are well-positioned to collaborate with DAOs. Our proven track record with other reputable DAOs demonstrates our ability to navigate DAO governance, meet KYC requirements, and deliver financial products that uphold the high transparency and security standards demanded by decentralized organizations like MakerDAO. Matrixdock also has experience working with a wide range of legal structures, including LLPs, corporations, trusts, and other legal entities, further reinforcing our capability to support MakerDAO’s strategic objectives.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem?

STBT brings more than just yield to the MakerDAO ecosystem. By integrating STBT into MakerDAO’s treasury, MakerDAO gains access to a robust, real-world asset-backed product that enhances overall treasury stability and liquidity. Our industry-leading transparency practices, including the unique Transparency Panel and Chainlink’s Proof of Reserves, reinforce the trust and reliability that MakerDAO’s stakeholders expect.

Importantly, STBT can also be minted using DAI, MakerDAO’s stablecoin. This creates a seamless integration that not only strengthens the utility and demand for DAI but also allows MakerDAO to leverage its own stablecoin in acquiring STBT, further solidifying its role in the DeFi ecosystem.

In addition to STBT, Matrixdock is committed to expanding its portfolio of real-world asset (RWA) products, further deepening our collaboration with MakerDAO in the future. By launching new RWA offerings tailored to the needs of decentralized ecosystems, we aim to provide MakerDAO with a broader range of asset-backed products that enhance stability and liquidity. This evolving suite of RWA solutions will not only support MakerDAO’s treasury diversification goals but also create new opportunities for long-term cooperation and growth within the ecosystem.

Integrating STBT can also attract a broader range of institutional and retail participants from Matrixport’s ecosystem, who prioritize the security and stability of RWA-backed assets. Additionally, MakerDAO can leverage Matrixdock’s extensive RWA network in Asia, gaining access to traditional finance resources like Asia OTC, asset sourcing, and community building.

This broader participation could help to further diversify and strengthen MakerDAO’s treasury, aligning with long-term strategic goals of risk management and capital efficiency.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

STBT is designed with secure interoperability in mind, and it is already integrated into different DeFi verticals such as

  • DEX for swaps and liquidity provisioning ie Curve
  • Collateral for stablecoins ie Verified USD
  • Collateral for borrowing/lending ie Term Finance
  • Multi-chain mobility ie CCIP including Ethereum and Arbitrum

Beyond DeFi, STBT’s compatibility with traditional financial systems is facilitated through our OTC network and a growing range of RWA products, which is part of our broader strategy to create a seamless interface between fiat and crypto worlds. Matrixdock’s infrastructure is built to support easy integration across multiple platforms, ensuring that STBT remains a versatile and secure asset within both DeFi and traditional finance ecosystems.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?

Yes, Matrixdock is committed to bringing the best-in-quality real-world assets on-chain, with the T-bill token being just the beginning of our journey in RWAs. We are actively developing a suite of tokenized RWAs designed to meet the specific needs of decentralized ecosystems. Our vision is to expand our offerings with a range of products tailored to the diverse risk preferences of MakerDAO ecosystem participants.

These upcoming products will provide portfolio managers with a broader spectrum of investment options, making them ideal for SparkDAO and other MakerDAO subDAOs seeking to diversify their treasury assets, optimize returns, and enhance capital efficiency. Our dedication to security, transparency, and seamless integration of real-world assets positions us as a key partner in supporting MakerDAO’s treasury management with the highest standards of innovation and stability.

Supplementary

STBT Transparency Panel is the first in the industry to leverage on recognized third-party independent oversight to enhance greater transparency. The panel consists of reputable members from Verified USD Foundation, LayerZero Labs and Curve Finance. Panel members provide third-party verification of off-chain assets through direct view-only access of STBT’s bank and broker accounts. Monthly updates are published on the STBT website transparency page.

Should STBT be a successful inclusion to the Spark Grand Prix, it would be possible for an appointed member of MakerDAO to join the Transparency Panel.
